intro: Gouania dasyantha, commonly known as the hairy gouania, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pink in color. Its leaves are usually opposite and have a rough, hairy texture. Gouania dasyantha is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
